sources.content:
# âœ¨ Example: Postprocessing 1

Show how to use two consecutive prompts with one parameter each.

-   PIPELINE URL https://promptbook.studio/examples/postprocessing-1.book.md
-   INPUTâ€¯â€¯PARAMETER `{word}` Any single word
-   OUTPUT PARAMETER `{sentence}` Resulting sentence with two synonyms

<!--Graph-->
<!-- âš ï¸ WARNING: This code has been generated so that any manual changes will be overwritten -->

```mermaid
%% ðŸ”® Tip: Open this on GitHub or in the VSCode website to see the Mermaid graph visually

flowchart LR
  subgraph "âœ¨ Example: Postprocessing 1"

      direction TB

      input((Input)):::input
      synonym("ðŸ’¬ Synonym")
      input--"{word}"-->synonym
      sentence("ðŸ’¬ Sentence")
      input--"{word}"-->sentence
      synonym--"{wordSynonym}"-->sentence

      sentence--"{sentence}"-->output
      output((Output)):::output

      click synonym href "#synonym" "ðŸ’¬ Synonym";
      click sentence href "#sentence" "ðŸ’¬ Sentence";

      classDef input color: grey;
      classDef output color: grey;

  end;
```

### Example 1

-   EXAMPLE

```text
Happy
```

`-> {word}`

### Example 2

-   EXAMPLE

```text
Apple
```

`-> {word}`

## ðŸ’¬ Synonym

Synonym for word

-   POSTPROCESSING `unwrapResult`

```text
Write synonym for "{word}"
```

`-> {wordSynonym}`

### Example 1

-   EXAMPLE

```text
Joyful
```

`-> {wordSynonym}`

### Example 2

-   EXAMPLE

```text
Fruit
```

`-> {wordSynonym}`

## ðŸ’¬ Sentence

Sentence with word and wordSynonym

-   POSTPROCESSING `unwrapResult`
-   POSTPROCESSING `spaceTrim`

```text
Write sentence with "{word}" and "{wordSynonym}" in it
```

`-> {sentence}`

### Example 1

-   EXAMPLE

```text
I am very happy to see you and joyful to meet you.
```

`-> {sentence}`

### Example 2

-   EXAMPLE

```text
An apple or another fruit a day keeps the doctor away.
```

`-> {sentence}`
